metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14461 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
A specially crafted email delivered over SMTP and passed on to Dovecot byMTA can trigger an out of bounds read resulting in potential sensitiveinformation disclosure and denial of service. In order to trigger thisvulnerability, an attacker needs to send a specially crafted email messageto the server.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14461` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dovecot-core - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.4
dovecot-gssapi - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.4
dovecot-imapd - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.4
dovecot-ldap - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.4
dovecot-lmtpd - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.4
dovecot-managesieved - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.4
dovecot-mysql - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.4
dovecot-pgsql - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.4
dovecot-pop3d - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.4
dovecot-sieve - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.4
dovecot-solr - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.4
dovecot-sqlite - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.4
mail-stack-delivery - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: dovecot package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.4').
